column4: I really feel lost becasue for over a month now Pidgin has not been working for me and nobody has been able to help me fix it ... even going through the bug reporting process did not help
I am forced to use Kopete in Ubuntu becasue Pidgin is broken ... and I REALLY want to use Pidgin ...
hmm i thought a plug in might of been causing the problem... well then you gonna have to compile it from source
so I uninstall it from Synaptic .. and then wht?
oh no no! thats the problem... u need to purge it
ok type this "sudo aptitude remove --purge pidgin"
, b334 : doing that now .. but its downloading an awful lot of stuff ... I guess I need it all!?
